title: Eastenders' Dot Cotton reveals all about her saucy past as actress June Brown gets a BBC special for her 90th birthday
text:
TV Eastenders' Dot Cotton reveals all about her saucy past as actress June Brown gets a BBC special for her 90th birthday June admits she was absolute catnip to the men, and her personal life in general has contained enough drama for several years' worth of Eastenders episodes Share By Suchandrika Chakrabarti Jennifer Crothers 11:49, 11 FEB 2017 June Brown has played Dot Cotton since 'Enders began in 1985 (Photo: Mirrorpix) Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! It's no surprise that Eastenders veteran June Brown was a hit with the gentlemen in her younger years. 
She was a complete hottie when she was younger - and we've got the pictures to prove it. 
The beloved EastEnders star, who's been in the soap since 1985, was stunning. And doesn't she know it. 
Looking back at her youth between the ages of 18 sand 23, June says that she "seemed to attract the opposite sex." 
June, who turns 90 next month, also admitted she was quite into racy relations in her youth. A gorgeous picture of June Brown from her younger days (Photo: Rex Features) Read More 
Born in Suffolk in 1927, June was evacuated from her Ipswich childhood home at the tender age of 12 as World War Two broke out. 
Aged 18, she joined the royal Navy Wrens, and that's where she found her liberation. 
With that face, and in a time of great uncertainty, she learnt a lot about life and love. The June Brown we're more used to seeing, as Dot Cotton on Eastenders (Photo: BBC) Read More 
Speaking to The Sun , she says: 
"Because you couldn’t be sure what tomorrow might bring, you felt like making the most of today. 
"I hate the phrase ‘having sex’. I only ever made love. It had to have something almost spiritual about it. 
"Certainly between the ages of 18 and 23, when I married for the first time, I seemed to attract the opposite sex." 
"Well, I hope you’ll forgive me if I confirm that yes, I was very beautiful," the absolute legend told the Daily Mail back in 2013. "Certainly, between the ages of 18 and 23 when I married for the first time, I seemed to attract the opposite sex." Dot Cotton at work in the EastEnders launderette (Photo: BBC) Read More EastEnders bosses 'bid to stop spoilers leaking with changes to online cast lists' 
"Don't get me wrong. I wasn't a nymphomaniac," she wrote in her 2013 autobiography Before The Year Dot. "But I was sexually active although I kept quiet about it. You did back then. The war changed everything of course. 
"I was 12 when it broke out. I joined the Wrens at 18 and that gave me a tremendous sense of liberation. As you couldn't be sure what tomorrow might bring, you felt like making the most of today. 
"If I'd stayed at home I'd have married as a virgin." 
June has sadly lived through her fair share of tragedy too. 
June married actor John Garley, after meeting him at the Old Vic theatre in 1950. 
Tragically, he committed suicide in 1957, after suffering from depression for many years. 
June remarried again the next year, to Dixon of Dock Green actor Robert Arnold, and they had six children. He died in 2003 
When she was just five, her younger brother John died of pneumonia aged just 15 days old. 
Two years later, her older sister Marise died of an ear infection at the age of 8. Read More
